reviews.review: Muito bom

i love this game
10/10 IGN WOULD PLAY AGAIN

Killing Floor is a teambased first person shooter game made by Tripwire Interactive that puts an emphasis on teamwork. The main goal of the game is to work together with a team to kill a certain amount of zeds in each wave in order to get to wave 11 and kill the patriarch. Without working together with your team and forming a plan of some kind, you will die. That's one of the best things about Killing Floor, and one of the reasons why I love it so much. However this doesnt mean it's without its flaws.

There are 7 perks aka classes to choose from and they each play a specific role in your team. You'll level up after doing enough damage, getting headshots or killing a certain number of zeds. The higher you level up, the more benefits you recieve such as lower weapon costs and a starting weapon. However this isn't necessarily a good thing since it puts a big gap between newer players and the long time players. The perks themselves seperate Killing Floor from a bunch of other games since each one plays differently.

Guns are a plenty in Killing Floor with around 7 or so weapons per perk (more with dlc). Each perk weapon is special with the amount of damage it does, how fast it shoots, and the reload speed. Each weapon also has a different sound effect which really gives each weapon a unique feeling to them as well as making some weapons really statisfying to kill zeds with. This doesn't mean that all weapons are good though, some are unbalanced and are either too costly for it's own good, or not being better than some of the higher end guns. The berzerker perk however doesn't feel as fleshed out as the others since you're basically slapping the zeds while trying not to get hit.

Along with the many different guns, maps, and perks this game offers, there's also many different zed types. In total there are 10 different zed types including the patriarch and each of them behaves differently. Because of this, some perks and the weapons they use work well against certain zeds, another thing that makes Killing Floor one of my favorites. However, this requires you to memorize different strategies to use for each of the zeds resulting in a slightly difficult learning curve for newer players. Although memorizing the paterns comes naturally to some people since the behaviors correlate with the sound cues they give, so it isn't too big an issue.

Overall, if you're looking for a challenging fps game, you should definitely give this game a try. While Killing Floor 2 is already out and similar, the original Killing Floor feels like a different game entirely with different strategies than the second game. If you know anyone who plays Killing Floor, you should play with them as playing with friends makes this game much more enjoyable. You can usually find this game for under £7 during sales, or you can get it in the Digital Deluxe version of Killing Floor 2, but it suffers from a ton of bugs that ruin Killing Floor 2 (Microtransaction drops are bugged despite already being such a controversial feature, gg tripwire).

Pros:
► 7 perks / class to choose from
► Tons of weapons and maps
► Weapons sound great and each kill is satisfying
► Difficulty and zed count ramps up as more people join (teamwork is essential)
► A nice and fitting soundtrack
► Multiple types of zeds that behave differently
► Hilarious british accents

Cons:
► Unbalanced Weapons
► Melee isn't fleshed out as it could've been (fitting pun)
► There is an objective mode, but it only includes 3 official maps (you can however find some on the workshop)

Hit / Miss:
► Learning curve requires you to memorized what works against each zed, which might ward off newer players
► Somewhat slow start

Personal Rating:
Avoid at all costs
Pick up during a sale
Worth Playing
Must Play

Played on the Helm's Deep map with four friends.

The Patriarch shows up, we've already welded ourselves into the keep, and I've placed eight pipe bombs at the door.
After a few minutes, without any Patriarch, I decided to go up to the door and see if I could hear anything.

[b][u]"ONE IN THE PIPE"[/u][/b]

So, understandably, I screamed at the top of my lungs, for the door was about to blow open.
Except, rockets have splash damage, and at quite a large distance away, apparently...

You know those pipe bombs? Yeah, they blew up. Under me.
All my friends heard was a high pitched, blood curdling scream, and saw me blow up right in front of the door.

Then the air was filled with their own screams as a beast stormed in and started mowing them down because [b][u]SOME OF THEM FORGOT TO BUY BODY ARMOR

This review reflects my opinions and experiences with this game as a long time veteran.

Reason to why this is such an amazing game. This is a horror survival team based game which uses tactical advancements into defeating the game. You need to work with each and every perk differently against every zed (the "zombies"). The perks are very dedicated to each role but yet not limited to it. As you play with each perk you progressively become stronger in its speciality.

The zeds all have different appearances, behaviours, personality and abilities. Every zed is a different type of threat against each and every perk. Some have resistance, some have cloaks, other simply grabs you. Some perks are easier to deal with some zeds etc.

Weapon quality in this game is outstanding. Physics is old but good. But hey, it's from 2009. Sound could been better in terms of surround, it works, but it's not as strong as today's games. Support for mods is a plus. Amazing custom servers with so much flexibility. Some servers makes me think, "I thought I'd seen everything", but nope. If there is something to complain about at all (considering it's from 2009 and built upon Unreal Tournament 2004) it's the server management in terms of searching for servers. It can be laggy sometimes. Considering that's the only thing I can really complain about, it's a pretty darn good game.

There is no other game that offers the type of gameplay as Killing Floor do. It got all the good from all the corners. The core system does not resemble any one game at all. You got the perk system, you got the different zeds with personality, you got highly realistic weapons and it's heavily team based where tactics is the key, as introduced above.

The game is taking place in London where Horzine Biotech, a biotechnology company is centered. This company specializes in mass cloning and genetic manipulation for military purposes. But things goes wrong where the human subjects exhibits mutation and disfigurements. These "zeds" breaks out and it's up to you to take em down.

The game sounds easy, but it is not. If you want a true challenge however, play Hell on Earth difficulty. This is true horror which also requires heavily reliable teamwork. It's going to test all your abilities as a teamplayer, skills, tactics, survivability and knowledge of the game.

I dearly recommend this game to anyone, it's fun, competitive, and offers great experience and with an amazing community and workshop, you can never go wrong.

~ONE IN THE PIPE

Killing Floor is one of my all-time favorite co-op FPS's. The game is structured extremely well towards helping out your teammates, almost but not quite to the point that it punishes you for playing solo. I will say that I've never managed to beat even the easiest possible game solo, so online co-op is pretty much the only way to go. Luckily, the game has a large community following, even after the release of the sequel, so it shouldn't be too hard to find a good game. The different perks and many available weapons offer a lot of versatility in available ways to slaughter the zeds, although some of the perks are unfairly difficult to level up (I'm looking at you, commando).

Definitely recommended!

EDIT: Many years later, I have managed to beat several games solo, at hard difficulty (but not nightmare). I've gotten better! :D
I find it weird how this game could go from 5 dollars to 21 dollars, but who am I to judge? Its a great game with fun gameplay

СУПЕР ИГРА  ПО СРОВНЕНИЮ СО ВТОРОЙ

Allora, partiamo dal fatto che un giorno andai a squola, vidi un armadietto che si apriva poi però si chiuse, rimasi del tutto sbalordito dalle animazioni, andai di corsa in bagno e defecai sul lavandino della squola. tornai a casa perchè scoprii di avere il cancro al tumore, i miei genitori piansero per più o meno circa 5 ore e 27 minuti e circa 3/4 secondi. Un giorno però ebbi l'illuminazione mentre facevo la chemio, decisi di morire più velocemente dato che avevo oramai il cancro al tumore in uno stadio avanzato, quindi comprai killing floor! Che dire? Emanava odore di feci sin dall'inizio, giocammo io e i miei genitori, ma morirono loro, caso! La stessa notte del decesso dei miei vidi un ancielo volare sul tetto della casa, lo aggrappai ed era richard benson. Piansi piansi e piansi! Tornando a killing floor, grafica eccezionale gameplay alla vaniglia e audio che sembra di essere in vietnam! Vado a fare la chemio vi saluto amici di steam.

[Hisrotia]

El juego tiene lugar en Londres, Inglaterra. 
Horzine Biotech, la empresa de biotecnología,es contratado para llevar a cabo experimentos de 
carácter militar Involucrar a la clonación de masas y la manipulación genética. 
Algo va muy mal durante el proceso de la experimentación y seres humanos comienzan a exhibir 
las mutaciones y la desfiguración grotesca. 
Se vuelven cada vez hostil, y invadidos Eventualmente las fuerzas de seguridad interna de la 
corporación.

Horas más tarde, las primeras oleadas de los especímenes estallan en la superficie,lo que 
altera la protesta de la paz fuera de la contratista militar conocida. A pesar de los mejores 
esfuerzos de la Policía Local,los civiles son rápidamente abrumado y consumida por la fuente 
aparentemente interminable de clones ahora de transmisión desde las fauces abiertas de la sede 
de Horzine Biotech. 

Habiendo escapado Su prisión estéril, las criaturas comienzan a desplegarse a las áreas 
vecinas, devorando los ciudadanos indefensos de Londres,mientras que la Policía Metropolitana
infructuosamente intentan defenderse.

Desesperado por contener el brote de alcanzar el extranjero prevista por el científico mutado 
y mejorado cibernéticamente Dr. Kevin "El Patriarca" Clamely,el gobierno británico rápidamente
comienza a organizar equipos de gentuza de sobrevivir a los soldados del Ejército británico y
oficiales especiales de policía Branch para luchar contra las hordas de zeds "especímenes".

El jugador toma el papel de un miembro de uno de estos equipos mientras participan en una 
variedad de misiones en los alrededores de la ciudad de Londres.

[Genero]

FPS Co-Op Survival Horror - Disparos en Primera Persona Coperativo Supervivencia Horror

[Mecanica de juego]

Killing Floor tiene 2 modos de juego supervivencia y Objetivo, ademas modo multiplayer

1 - [Modo Supervivencia]

El juego trata de sobrevivir 1 a 6 jugadores en los mas de 30 Mapas por Oleadas llenos de 
Especimenes(Zeds) que te daran Puntos (dinero) Por cada zed que mates.
al final de cada Oleada habra un tiempo de Trader(Mercader) para recargar o comprar armas
asi hasta llegar a la Oleada final donde enfrentaremos al Patriach (Patriarca)

Para Sobrevivir a cada oleada debes selecionar uno de los 7 Perk (Privilegio)
Cada perk tiene beneficios y abilidades diferentes,todos los perk se manejan por niveles de
0 a 6

[Sistema de Perk]

   Perk            |    Ataques basados    |   Algunos Beneficios y abilidades
__________________ | _____________________ | _________________________________________________
Berserker          | Cuerpo a cuerpo       | Resitencia Ataques   . Mas velocidad
CommandO           | Metralletas           | Ver vida de los zeds . ver zeds invisibles 
Demolition         | Explosivos            | Resistencia a explosivos . 
Field Medic        | Curar a los Copañeros | mayor vida . mas veloz
Firebug            | Fuego                 | resistencia al fuego
Sharpshooter       | Pistolas y Rifles     | recarga rapida . mejor presición
Support Specialist | Escopetas             | mayor espacio para armas . soldar mas rapido

2 - [Modo Objetivo]

Este modo de juego 1 a 6 jugadores tienen que sobrevivir de los Zeds y que complir una serie 
de objetivos entre oleadas asi recorrer por los 4 mapas.

En este modo hay que saber cual perk es mas combeniente utilizar segun objetivo

3 - [Multiplayer]

Este modo en su mayor parte es el modo supervivencia en forma original de juego, pero los mas 
de 500 servidores usan Mods (modificadores) y Mutators (mutadores) asi creando sus propios 
balances y dificultades.

- и многое другое!..

Das Spielprinzip ist einfach, bis zu 6 Spieler kämpfen in bis zu 10 Wellen gegen Computergesteuerte Monster, in Runde 11 geht es dann gegen den sogenannten Patriarchen. Dieser ist tödliche im Nahkampf und schießt mit MG und Raketen, ist also ein ordentlicher Brocken der schon so manch hart erkämpftes Vorankommen in Runde 11 eiskalt beendet hat. Außer dem Patriarchen gibt es sechs andere Gegnertypen von leicht bis schwer zu besiegen, die je nach Typus in unterschiedlicher Anzahl auf der Map erscheinen. Über die Maps kann man sich nicht beklagen, sie sind in ausreichender Zahl vorhanden und per Steam Workshop gibt es weitere zum download. Die offiziellen Maps reichen von großen Bauernhöfen über Krankenhäuser bis zum dichten Dschungel, für Abwechslung ist also gesorgt.   

Zur Wahl stehen sechs Perks (Sanitäter, Unterstützer, Scharfschütze, Kommando, Berserker, Pyro und Sprengmeister), die alle mit ihren spezifischen Waffen (und dazugehörige Boni) bis Level 7 gelevelt werden können. Ein Scharfschütze Level 7 macht pro Schuss also mehr Schaden als einer Level 2. Das Aussehen der Spielfigur kann man im Prinzip frei wählen, dafür gibt es viele offizielle Charakter Skins und Hunderte aus dem Steam Workshop. 

Den Reiz des Spiels macht einfach das Kooperative Zusammenspiel mit anderen Spielern aus, sich allein durch die Gegnermassen zu schießen macht eben nur halb soviel Spaß wie zusammen mit fünf anderen. Besonders auf den höheren der fünf Schwierigkeitsgrade ist Teamwork Pflicht. Jeder getötet Gegner bringt hierbei das Level des gewählten Perks durch den ausgeteilten Schaden höher und bringt einem zusätzlich Geld für neue Waffen ein. An unterschiedlichen Waffen mangelt es dem Spiel ebenfalls nicht, nach den Perks unterteilt gibt es Waffen die wenig Schaden machen bis zu Waffen die viel Schaden machen, natürlich zu aufsteigenden Preisen.

Für jeden der Spaß an Kooperativen Videospielen hat, gerne Shooter spielt und sich gerne auf Erfolgejagt macht ist Killing Floor motivierend über sehr viele Stunden hinweg. Ab dem „Normalen“ Schwierigkeitsgrad gibt es für jede der 33 offiziellen Maps einen Erfolg, macht also schon 132 Erfolge nur für das erfolgreiche Abschließen der Maps. Dazu kommen noch Unmengen anderer Erfolge die in einem gewissen Zusammenhang schon mal einen besonderen Skin (z.B. Sensenmann) freischalten. Um es zum Schluss nochmal zu erwähnen für genügend Motivation und Spielspaß ist gesorgt! ;)

Всем приветики :)) Сразу скажу, что знаю эту игру с 2010 года. Многим она может показаться примитивной, однообразной, но когда ты знакомишься с новыми людьми и вы играете в команде, то сразу появляется интерес :) Раньше было кажется 7 уровней, сейчас 6 ( в классическом варианте). Появилось множество новых серверов и карт, это и позволяет игре держаться на плаву, так сказать) Для эмоциональной разгрузки она самое то! Не нужно особо напрягать мозги и что-то там добывать или выполнять какие-то задания) Бегаешь себе, херачишь зомби, своим помогаешь- и вроде как жизнь удалась) И учитывая то, что я далеко не заядлый игроман, эта игра меня вполне устраивает) Спасибо за внимание и всем пакеда! :D

Несмотря на то что уже есть вторая часть, я всё равно буду играть в первую и это моя самая любимая игра. Саундтрек радует и в неё хорошо играть с друзьями и находить новых друзей. Обидно конечно что многие уже и забыли про первую и ушли во вторую, даже не выбив все ачивы. Теперь мала с кем играть, но я надеюсь, что хотя бы немного людей останутся в первой части и мне не придётся одной играть. Для других игра может показаться и не очень, но хотелось чтобы люди пополняли и пополняли ряд этой игры, чтобы многие серверы не пустовали, а пополнялись игроками.

One of the best modern FPSs.

>Statisfying CRACK sound from getting headshots, like smashing a pumpkin with a hammer
>no hipfire bullet spread. Finally, your mouse actually means something.
>Guns that actually sound like guns
>enemies that actually require different strategies in order to defeat them (though there is not much variety in this)
>Heavy metal.
>fantastic mods and mod servers. You can shoot gachapin and mukku in tachikawa station.

Some people didn't like the grind, but I thought it was a good way to weed out the casual and bad players that ruin a team-work oriented game. However, I think that it should have been based more on skill rather than grind, because any bad player could reach max level for a class if they played enough, while a person with a rich background in FPSs and not being an idiot, will not necessarily bother to finish the grind.

However:
>Alt-tabbing sucks. I believe it reloads a lot of the textures on to your GPU memory above the stuff they already loaded onto there, so after several alt-tabs, the game will crash. 
>some weapons are DLC, but they are not necessary.
>game is less populated thanks to the mediocre sequel.
>enemy AI is very simple. The game is designed as such, so it's not a game-breaking AI failure like in many games. But it could have been more.

In the current stage though, I cannot recommend it, simply because the servers are not that populated anymore.

Now that Killing Floor 2 is out, and that I have played it for about 30 minutes, I can say that the first Killing Floor(KF1) was much better. The fast pace game of Killing Floor 2(KF2) just doesn't fit if you have played KF1. KF1 was very laggy which made the slow motion kills bareable. In KF2, it feels as though the slow motion kills are a waste of time. Both games are also Very repetitive. The recoil of the KF2 guns is also very high which may be realistic but is very annoying. I would'nt even recommend buying KF1 at this point because probably most of the players that played KF1 have moved onto KF2. Overall these games are not as bad as I say they are, however I don't belive these games are worth buying IF you plan to play them for a very long time such as counterstrike.

loadsamoney!!!!!!!

I can't recommend Killing Floor, and I know Ill get some flak.
Some of you people already know that Killing Floor is a Unreal 2004 mod, or started as a mod. To me its a [b]total conversion mod[/b]. Or maybe you would like me to call this mod a game? Alright then.

It's dated, but there are other games older than Killing Floor, that look and play way better. One superb example is Half life 2. Half life 2 with few texture updates looks fantastic, see [url=store.steampowered.com/app/290930/]Half Life 2: Update[/url]. If you don't own Half Life 2 and enjoy playing FPS games, May I ask what the hell is wrong with you?

I will point out everything that is bad about Killing Floor 2:

[h1]Visuals:[/h1]
Physics apply only to Ragdolls
No Destructible enviroment
No dynamic Light.
No Dynamic ragdol animations and only has 1 walk cycle, when switching axis the whole model rotates instead.
No Bumpmaps
No ground texture Reflections
No Depth of Field
No Ambient Occlusion
[b]And a lot more I don't have to mention.[b]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Terrible difficulty scale. (Less money earnings, Stronger Mobs, Mobs inflict stronger Damage, Increased wave size)
No Crosshair
Weapon Animations are bugged and sometimes you can't see that you reaload your weapon.
To level up your perks is a nightmare
You have to switch to knife to run faster
AI Completely basic just charging at you
You don't have Sprint
Instead Of Sprint you can walk, Shift key is completely useless in this game. You will get nothing but walk slower.
Trader menu is hard to navigate, it will have to register the process then you can make your pick.


For the asking price, you can play better games. Play Left 4 Dead 2 Instead.
